de.uni_mannheim.informatik.dws.jrdf2vec.walk_generation.base

Interface IWalkGenerationManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DBpediaWalkGenerationManagerLight, WalkGenerationManager, WalkGenerationManagerDefault, WalkGenerationManagerLight

    public interface IWalkGenerationManager
    Interface for all walk generation managers.

    • Method Detail

      • generateWalks

        void generateWalks(WalkGenerationMode generationMode,
                   int numberOfThreads,
                   int numberOfWalksPerEntity,
                   int depth,
                   int textWalkLength,
                   String walkFile)
        Generate walks according to the stated method.
        Parameters:
        generationMode - The algorithm to be used for the walk generation.
        numberOfThreads - The number of threads to be run.
        numberOfWalksPerEntity - The number of walks that shall be performed per entity.
        depth - The depth of each walk. Depth 1 leads to three elements in the walk, depth 2 leads to 5 elements in the walk.
        textWalkLength - Length of text walks. Note that unlike depth, here only the number of tokens in the walk are counted (not node hops!). Typically the window size would be used as text walk length.
        walkFile - The walk file.

      • generateRandomWalks

        void generateRandomWalks(int numberOfThreads,
                         int numberOfWalksPerEntity,
                         int depth)
        The walk file(s) will be persisted in "./walks".
        Parameters:
        numberOfThreads - The number of threads to be run.
        numberOfWalksPerEntity - The number of walks that shall be performed per entity.
        depth - The depth of each walk.

        void generateRandomWalks(int numberOfThreads,

                         String filePathOfFileToBeWritten)
        Generates random walks.
        Parameters:
        numberOfThreads - The number of threads to be run.
        numberOfWalksPerEntity - The number of walks that shall be performed per entity.
        depth - The depth of each walk.
        filePathOfFileToBeWritten - The path to the file that shall be written.

        Parameters:
        numberOfThreads - The number of threads to be run.

        depth - The depth of each walk.

      • generateRandomMidWalks

        void generateRandomMidWalks(int numberOfThreads,
                            int numberOfWalksPerEntity,
                            int depth)
        Generates mid walks, duplicate walks are possible. A mid walk is a random walk that involves a given entity but may not start or end with the entity in question.
        Parameters:
        numberOfThreads - The number of threads to be used.
        numberOfWalksPerEntity - The maximal number of walks that shall be performed per entity.
        depth - The depth of each walk where the depth is the number of node-hops, i.e. depth 1 leads to a sentence with one hop and three elements: S → P → O.

      • generateRandomMidWalks

        void generateRandomMidWalks(int numberOfThreads,
                            int numberOfWalksPerEntity,
                            int depth,
                            String filePathOfFileToBeWritten)
        Generates mid walks, duplicate walks are possible. A mid walk is a random walk that involves a given entity but may not start or end with the entity in question.
        Parameters:
        numberOfThreads - The number of threads to be used.
        numberOfWalksPerEntity - The maximal number of walks that shall be performed per entity.
        depth - The depth of each walk where the depth is the number of node-hops, i.e. depth 1 leads to a sentence with one hop and three elements: S → P → O.
        filePathOfFileToBeWritten - The path to the file that shall be written.

      • generateWeightedMidWalks

        void generateWeightedMidWalks(int numberOfThreads,
                              int numberOfWalksPerEntity,
                              int depth)
        Generates weighted mid walks, duplicate walks are possible.
        Parameters:
        numberOfThreads - The number of threads to be used.
        numberOfWalksPerEntity - The maximal number of walks that shall be performed per entity.
        depth - The depth of each walk where the depth is the number of node-hops, i.e. depth 1 leads to a sentence with one hop and three elements: S → P → O.

      • generateWeightedMidWalks

        void generateWeightedMidWalks(int numberOfThreads,
                              int numberOfWalksPerEntity,
                              int depth,
                              String filePathOfFileToBeWritten)
        Generates weighted mid walks, duplicate walks are possible.
        Parameters:
        numberOfThreads - The number of threads to be used.
        numberOfWalksPerEntity - The maximal number of walks that shall be performed per entity.
        depth - The depth of each walk where the depth is the number of node-hops, i.e. depth 1 leads to a sentence with one hop and three elements: S → P → O.
        filePathOfFileToBeWritten - The path to the file that shall be written.

      • generateRandomMidWalksDuplicateFree

        void generateRandomMidWalksDuplicateFree(int numberOfThreads,
                                         int numberOfWalksPerEntity,
                                         int depth)
        Generates mid walks without duplicates. A mid walk is a random walk that involves a given entity but may not start or end with the entity in question.
        Parameters:
        numberOfThreads - The number of threads to be used.
        numberOfWalksPerEntity - The maximum number of walks that shall be performed per entity. Note that the actual number of generated walks might be lower.
        depth - The depth of each walk where the depth is the number of node-hops, i.e. depth 1 leads to a sentence with one hop and three elements: S → P → O.

      • generateRandomMidWalksDuplicateFree

        void generateRandomMidWalksDuplicateFree(int numberOfThreads,
                                         int numberOfWalksPerEntity,
                                         int depth,
                                         String filePathOfFileToBeWritten)
        Generates mid walks without duplicates. A mid walk is a random walk that involves a given entity but may not start or end with the entity in question.
        Parameters:
        numberOfThreads - The number of threads to be used.
        numberOfWalksPerEntity - The maximum number of walks that shall be performed per entity. Note that the actual number of generated walks might be lower.
        depth - The depth of each walk where the depth is the number of node-hops, i.e. depth 1 leads to a sentence with one hop and three elements: S → P → O.
        filePathOfFileToBeWritten - The path to the file that shall be written.

      • generateTextWalks

        void generateTextWalks(int numberOfThreads,
                       int walkLength)
        Generate text walks.
        Parameters:
        numberOfThreads - he number of threads to be used.
        walkLength - The length of the walks (!= hops). An example for a walk of length 3 would be "s → p → o"

      • generateTextWalks

        void generateTextWalks(int numberOfThreads,
                       int walkLength,
                       String filePathOfFileToBeWritten)
        Generate text walks.
        Parameters:
        numberOfThreads - he number of threads to be used.
        walkLength - The length of the walks (!= hops). An example for a walk of length 3 would be "s → p → o"
        filePathOfFileToBeWritten - The path to the file that shall be written.
